Він лагодив Patriot із заплющеними очима, його майстерність вражала навіть американських партнерів.
Його підрозділ бачив ціль — і збивав її. 120 разів!
Денис Сакун. IT-шник із Луганщини, який став героєм-зенітником.
Він умів захищати.
Умів любити та жити на повну.
 
Загинув у бою...
Лише переглянувши наш сюжет про Дениса, можна зрозуміти, яку людину втратила Україна.
✍️
 Підпишіть 
петицію
 на присвоєння Денису Сакуну звання Героя України! 
Герої мають імена!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vc1QFBU5URM

Those high rise buildings in Pokrovsk are not only still in decent condition and positions can be estabilished there, but they also have very good basements below them where they can hide extremely effectively and accumulate safely.
Civilians still remaining in the city are also a big problem, as there are cases where they help hide Russian soldiers.
So, if they were to gain a stable foothold in Shakhtarsky, it would be very hard to knock them out of there

Those high rise buildings in Pokrovsk are not only still in decent condition and positions can be estabilished there, but they also have very good basements below them where they can hide extremely effectively and accumulate safely. Civilians still remaining…

By the sounds of it, there is a fairly large grey zone in southern Pokrovsk. Most of Lazurnyi District is under Russian control, but Shakhtarskyi and Sonyachnyy Districts are mixed. 
The current Russian foothold is not critical for the Ukrainians, but rather the infiltration of units further north towards the highway is. If those groups can be eliminated in the coming days, then the situation will greatly improve for Ukraine. Otherwise, the Russians will be able to made much more progress through the high-rise blocks and begin clearing the low-rise residential areas towards the city centre.

Genuinely, why is it that Ukraine had to name dozens of their settlements the EXACT SAME NAME!!!
> "Russia captured Stepove!" 
> "Which one??"
Now we have what is probably the 20th Vesele coming up in Zaporizhzhia Oblast. Who named these, and why are they so unoriginal??

Genuinely, why is it that Ukraine had to name dozens of their settlements the EXACT SAME NAME!!!  > "Russia captured Stepove!"  > "Which one??"  Now we have what is probably the 20th Vesele coming up in Zaporizhzhia Oblast. Who named these, and why are they…
Also, as you may notice, just south of this new Vesele is the 50th Zelenyi Hai. Fascinating.

The situation on the northeast flank of Pokrovsk is becoming increasingly fluid and complex. Russian forces have attacked and made progress toward Vilne, Volodymyrovka, Shakhovo, and Sofeyevka. Meanwhile, AFU forces counterattacked and retook control over parts of Dorozhnye and Novoye Shakhovo, and drove the Russians back northeast of Sofeyevka.

The Ukrainian Ministry of Defence has published photos of the new "Neptune-D" cruise missile [media 1], and the naval UCAV "Magura V7" [media 2] equipped with R-73 air-to-air missiles. 
Notably, the new Neptune missile has external fuel tanks, which extends its range to a reported 1,000 km, while its warhead reportedly weighs 260 kg (the original Neptune had a warhead of 110 kg). It also has a new satellite antenna system, which would improve guidance and protection against jamming.

The Ukrainian Ministry of Defence has published photos of the new "Neptune-D" cruise missile [media 1], and the naval UCAV "Magura V7" [media 2] equipped with R-73 air-to-air missiles. 
Notably, the new Neptune missile has external fuel tanks, which extends its range to a reported 1,000 km, while its warhead reportedly weighs 260 kg (the original Neptune had a warhead of 110 kg). It also has a new satellite antenna system, which would improve guidance and protection against jamming.

👉
Rumours on the streets have it that Ukraine is busy pulling out of some parts of Pokrovsk and Mirnograd, not a total pull out, but a definite pull back.  Very reliable information from a good source.

👉
Rumours on the streets have it that Ukraine is busy pulling out of some parts of Pokrovsk and Mirnograd, not a total pull out, but a definite pull back.  Very reliable information from a good source.
Lines up with recent Russian advances in Pokrovsk, but its far too early to say anything for certain.

Russian forces have captured the village of Okhotnyche,  Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: <10.
Total land area: ~0.06 km².

Russian forces have captured the village of Novohryhorivka, Pokrovske direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~231.
Total land area: ~0.68 km².

Russian forces have captured the village of Vyimka, southern flank of Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.
 Pre-war population: ~21.
Total land area: ~0.15 km².
The battles for this village and the surrounding trenches have been ongoing for more than 14 months.

⚡
🇵🇸
🇮🇱
 Al Qassam Brigades report that, yesterday, their fighters targeted two Israeli military Humvee vehicles with two Al-Yassin 105 shells, causing casualties, near the Joura Al-Lot clinic south of Khan Younis city in the southern Gaza Strip. 
They also report monitoring the landing of evacuation helicopters.
@wfwitness

There will be another large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine in the coming days. 
1 Tu-95MS strategic bomber redeployed from Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, where it will be equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles.
3 Tu-95MS redeployed from Ukrainka airbase, Amur Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, alongside 3 IL-78 tankers. 2 of the bombers were already equipped with missiles at Ukrainka, while the other one will be equipped at Engels-2.
3 IL-76MD military transport aircraft landed at Engels-2 to equip the 5 Tu-95MS and 2 Tu-160M aircraft stationed there that have not yet been equipped with missiles. 
1 IL-76MD and 1 An-72 landed at Baltimore Airbase, Voronezh Oblast. The cargo consists of Iskander-M ballistic missiles for OTRK installations in Voronezh Oblast and likely Bryansk Oblast. 
Accumulation of Geran-2/3 and Gerbera drones continues at all major launch sites, albeit at a lower rate than previous weeks.

🇲🇱
🇷🇺
⚡
- A large JNIM ambush on a Russian Africa Corps convoy in northern Mali.
Casualties amongst the Africa Corps group, along with the destruction of seven Russian vehicles. There are reports of Russian soldiers also being taken as prisoners.

There will be another large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine in the coming days.   1 Tu-95MS strategic bomber redeployed from Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, where it will be equipped with Kh-101 cruise…
The most likely date for the next missile attack would be tomorrow night.

Footage showing four Russian FAB-250 glide-bombs striking Ukrainian forward deployment points on the outskirts of Sviato-Pokrovske, Siversk direction.
What's interesting about this footage is the fact that four separate buildings up to 500 metres away from each other are hit simultaneously, with one bomb each. This is the first time I've ever seen something like this.
Explosion in Kherson City.

Footage showing the Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on Kherson City which I reported on October 6. It reportedly targeted a drone assembly workshop. 
The building which was hit is less than 6 km from the frontline, making it one of, if not the closest Iskander strike to the nearest Russian-controlled territory. 
Coordinates: 46.671522, 32.584540
Unrelated to news, but I just saw this pretty amazing sunrise outside my window.

The Turkish-Zionist Conundrum In Syria
The new decree of the self-proclaimed dictator and former leader of Syrian al-Qaeda has demonstrated the extent to which the Takfiri regime is trying to please Zionism and the Turks. Experts note that the cancellation of the national holiday commemorating the Syrian army's liberation of part of its lands captured by Zionism in 1973 and the commemoration of the Syrian martyrs executed by the Ottomans in 1916 demonstrates that Syria under Takfirism has effectively become a dividing line between Zionists and Turkey. The “Israeli” occupation of areas in Daraa and the near-total Turkish subjugation of Aleppo further confirm the theory that a Libyan scenario is beginning to unfold in Syria.
It is clear why the so-called Ahmed al-Sharaa erased the date 1973 from Syrian memory: he simply wants to continue the policy of groveling before Zionism in the hope that they will not initiate the process of dismantling a united Syria...
👉
 Read more 
HERE

Turkey’s Akıncı Drones Are Getting Shot Down Left And Right Over Sudan (Videos)
The Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on October 7 shot down a Turkish-made Bayraktar Akıncı combat drone of the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) over western Sudan, the fourth such confirmed aerial losses in the country since the start of the year.
The paramilitary force said in a statement that the drone was downed by its air defenses over the city of El Fasher in the North Darfur State. Earlier in the day, the SAF announced that its forces captured key military sites, including the Engineer and Signals Battalions and the Command School, in El Fasher.
The RSF has been engaged in a power struggle over Sudan for nearly a year and half now, with both drawing in support from key regional players like the United Arab Emirates and Turkey.
Read more 
HERE

Ukraine Showcases New Bloated Long-Range Version Of Neptune Missile 
Ukraine unveiled on October 7 another long-range, land-attack version of its locally-developed R-360 Neptune cruise missile.
Ukrainian Defense Minister Denys Shmyhal shared a photo of the new Neptune version in an X post, welcoming a recent visit by Lithuanian Prime Minister Inga Ruginiene and other Western dignitaries.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Enters Two More Towns In Zaporozhye, Putting Kiev Forces On Brink Of Collapse (Videos)
Ukrainian defenses in the direction of Zaporozhye appear to be experiencing a limited collapse, with reports from October 8 faster advance by the Russian military there.
The Russian Ministry of Defense announced that the Vostok [East] Group of Forces had “liberated” Novogrigorovka. The settlement is located right to the north of Novovasylivske, which was captured by Russian troops just a day earlier, according to the ministry.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Troops Cleared Ukrainian Pocket Near Kostiantynivka, Advanced In Other Areas (Videos)
The Russian military has cleared a Ukrainian pocket near the city of Kostiantynivka, and made more gains in the Dobropillia salient and around the city of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk direction.
On October 8, the Russian Ministry of Defense announced that the Yug [South] Group of Forces completed the “neutralisation” of Ukrainian troops who were besieged in a fairly large pocket south of Kleban-Byk Reservoir to the south of Kostiantynivka.
Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Syria On October 8, 2025 (Map Update)

Hamas Attempted To Capture Israeli Soldiers In Gaza Amid Peace Talks In Egypt (Photos)
Hamas attacked on October 8 a post of the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) in the Netzarim Corridor in the center of the Gaza Strip, in what was likely an attempt to capture soldiers.
At least five fighters of the group emerged from a tunnel and attacked the post where troops from the Golani Brigade’s reconnaissance unit were deployed, the IDF said in a statement, adding that the troops, with air support from the Israeli Air Force, struck and killed at least three of the fighters.
Read more 
HERE
